decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Sprite Dragon, supplemented by cheap disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Fatal Push. The goal is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion and value over the course of the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's triple-color requirements and maximize efficiency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on aggressively utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful threat, while also making use of low-cost spells and creatures to control the board and generate card advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by recurring key cards from the graveyard. By combining efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push with disruptive hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to maintain tempo and pressure the opponent quickly in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck relies on assembling a toolbox of creatures to find the necessary pieces to go off with the combo involving Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies. The goal is to generate infinite mana and then tutor for a win condition such as Walking Ballista. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a valuable companion, while cards like Postmortem Lunge and Eladamri's Call help set up the combo. The deck also includes protection like Giver of Runes and Spellskite, as well as card selection with Mishra's Bauble and Horizon Canopy.

The main concept of this Ad Nauseam combo deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to cast Ad Nauseam, usually with the help of mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism. Once Ad Nauseam is cast, the player aims to draw their entire library and find Thassa's Oracle to win the game. The deck also includes cards like Angel's Grace and Phyrexian Unlife to protect the player from losing the game when their life total would reach zero. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on using Death's Shadow as a powerful threat that grows as you lose life, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Tarmogoyf to quickly pressure the opponent. The deck also includes a package of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck runs various ways to protect and pump up Death's Shadow, such as Mutagenic Growth and Temur Battle Rage, to help close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck revolves around ramping up mana quickly to play powerful lands and creatures that combo together to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor, Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, and Primeval Titan, the deck can generate massive amounts of mana and deal significant amounts of damage in a single turn. Additionally, Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and disruption options, while Ancient Stirrings helps to find key pieces of the combo. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its key cards and win the game through a powerful combination of mana acceleration and creature synergy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by slowing down your opponent's strategy with counterspells, removal, and board wipes while generating card advantage with cards like Uro and Teferi. By utilizing Yorion as a companion, you have access to additional value through blinking your permanents for more resources. The deck also includes efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Ice-Fang Coatl to provide additional threats and utility. With a versatile mana base and strong late-game potential, this Bant Control deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a longer game.

The key concept of this deck is to use a combination of cards to quickly generate mana and tutor for combo pieces, specifically Allosaurus Rider and Neoform, to execute a powerful and game-ending combo. The deck is focused on quickly assembling the combo pieces and utilizing cards like Nourishing Shoal and Chancellor of the Tangle to gain life and generate value. By efficiently ramping and tutoring for key cards, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a swift and decisive manner.

This Rakdos Aggro deck aims to quickly and aggressively pressure the opponent with low-cost creatures like Kiln Fiend, Abbot of Keral Keep, Soul-Scar Mage, and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also includes spells like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Lava Dart to remove opposing threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently using these cards and leveraging the graveyard with Cling to Dust, the deck seeks to maintain pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on aggressively reducing the opponent's life total while utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful threat. The key strategy involves playing low-cost spells to trigger prowess on Monastery Swiftspear and grow Death's Shadow, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize. The deck uses Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value by recurring important cards from the graveyard. By combining aggressive creature attacks with disruptive spells, this deck aims to swiftly defeat the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing versatile removal spells and hand disruption to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The key strategy revolves around using Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a card advantage engine while also providing a powerful win condition. The deck also utilizes the Bring to Light toolbox to find specific answers as needed. With a solid mana base and a consistent curve of threats and answers, this control deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through incremental advantages.

The deck focuses on using Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a powerful source of card advantage and control, utilizing a diverse range of multicolored cards to maximize his ability. With a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, the deck aims to control the game until it can overwhelm the opponent with its versatile and potent spells. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional consistency and mana acceleration to support the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures with haste and burn spells to deal damage quickly. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for constant recursion of cards like Seal of Fire and other one-drop spells. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of direct damage spells and creatures, seeking to end the game before the opponent can stabilize or mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through disruption and removal while ramping up mana with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. The deck also aims to shut down opponents' nonbasic lands with Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, limiting their resources. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful threats like Glorybringer and Kitchen Finks to apply pressure and close out the game. Klothys, God of Destiny provides additional value and disruption, making it difficult for opponents to stabilize. Overall, the deck focuses on resource denial and efficient threats to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to make Death's Shadow as big as possible, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Tarmogoyf to deal large amounts of damage to your opponent. The deck includes a combination of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to strip away your opponent's resources, along with powerful combat tricks like Temur Battle Rage to push through lethal damage. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to recast key creatures and spells from your graveyard.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana to cast big and powerful spells. The deck includes various powerful Planeswalkers such as Karn Liberated and Karn, the Great Creator, as well as large creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to help find and assemble the UrzaTron lands, ensuring consistent access to a large amount of mana.
